intro: Bladhia lentiginosa f. leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited bladhia, is a rare and unique variant of the bladhia species. It is characterized by its distinctive white or pale yellow fruits, which contrast with the typical green or red fruits of the species. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is native to specific regions in South America. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a lobed shape, contributing to its ornamental value. This form is of interest to botanists due to its unique coloration and potential for hybridization with other bladhia varieties.
